title: Quinton De Kock Back In Mumbai Colours; Reunited With Boult And Pollard
body:
Quinton de Kock is back in the MI set-up once again as the South African wicketkeeper batter has been snapped up by MI NY for the upcoming season of Major League Cricket (MLC). He will be reunited with Trent Boult and Kieron Pollard, his former teammates at the Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

De Kock, however, is not the only new recruit as MI NY have also snapped up Afghanistan‚Äôs Azmatullah Omarzai and South Africa‚Äôs George Linde. Left-arm spinner and lower-order batter Linde, in fact, plays for MI Cape Town (MICT) in the SA20.

New Zealand‚Äôs Michael Bracewell and Afghanistan‚Äôs Naveen-ul-Haq are the other star signings for MI NY while the highly-rated Agni Chopra, who averages 94 in first-class cricket and moved to the United States recently, is a significant signing on the domestic front.

MLC 2024 saw MI NY finish fourth, but they lost in the Eliminator to Texas Super Kings. The 2025 edition of the MLC will kick-off on June 12.

MI NY squad for MLC 2025

Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, Rashid Khan, Monank Patel, Nosthush Kenjige, Heath Richards, Ehsan Adil, Sunny Patel, Rushil Ugarkar, George Linde, Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, Naveen ul-Haq, Azmatullah Omarzai, Kunwarjeet Singh, Sharad Lumba, Agni Chopra, Tajinder Singh
summary:
* Quinton de Kock has joined MI NY for the upcoming season of MLC, reuniting with former Mumbai Indians teammates Trent Boult and Kieron Pollard.
* Other new signings for MI NY include Azmatullah Omarzai, George Linde, Michael Bracewell, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Agni Chopra.
* The MI NY squad for MLC 2025 has been announced, featuring a total of 17 players.
* The 2025 edition of the MLC is set to kick off on June 12.
* MI NY finished fourth in MLC 2024 but lost in the Eliminator to Texas Super Kings.

title: MI New York sign Quinton de Kock in Major League Cricket, USA
body:
Proteas wicketkeeper-batsman Quinton de Kock has joined MI New York for the 2025 edition of Major League Cricket in the United States of America.

De Kock previously played for the Seattle Orcas in MLC, USA.

De Kock, who has formally retired from ODI and Test cricket, but remains available for T20I selection, is currently playing for the Kolkata Knight Riders in this year‚Äôs Indian Premier League.

JOIN the Club Cricket SA Whatsapp channel

MI New York, meanwhile, have released South African trio Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis and Anrich Nortje.

‚ÄúAlthough it was a lovely run over the last two years, moments like these leave us with mixed feelings. While there is the happiness of MI New York retaining their core of players, there‚Äôs also the sadness of bidding goodbye to what was the lovely squad of 2024,‚Äù read a statement from MI New York.

MI New York and Washington Freedom are the most successful teams in the history of MLC, which started in 2023.

The 2025 tournament is scheduled to start on 12 June.

Several other South Africans are involved in MLC, including batsmen Faf du Plessis, Ryan Rickelton and Heinrich Klaasen ‚Äì and all-rounder Marco Jansen.

MORE latest cricket news
summary:
* Quinton de Kock, a South African wicketkeeper-batsman, has joined MI New York for the 2025 edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.
* De Kock previously played for the Seattle Orcas in MLC.
* MI New York has released three South African players: Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, and Anrich Nortje.
* The 2025 MLC tournament is scheduled to start on June 12, 2025.
* MI New York and Washington Freedom are the most successful teams in MLC history, which began in 2023.
* Other South African players involved in MLC include Faf du Plessis, Ryan Rickelton, Heinrich Klaasen, and Marco Jansen.

title: Quinton de Kock, Azmatullah Omarzai complete MI New York's squad for MLC 2025
body:
MI New York (MINY) have made significant additions to their squad ahead of the 2025 season of Major League Cricket (MLC), bringing in South African wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock and Afghan all-rounder Azmatullah Omarzai. These acquisitions will strengthen an already strong squad, as MINY look to bounce back from a disappointing campaign last year.

The New York-based franchise had a dream debut season in MLC, becoming champions in 2023. However in 2024, despite having an experienced core featuring Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan, the team struggled from the start. To rectify this, the franchise has opted for a major squad revamp, parting ways with some big international names while securing new players.

Quinton de Kock, a two-time IPL champion with Mumbai Indians, returns to the MI family after four years. Since retiring from international cricket in 2024, the left-hander has been playing in T20 leagues all around the world. His inclusion provides MI New York with a match-winner at the top of the order, an area where the team struggled last season.

Meanwhile, Afghanistan‚Äôs Omarzai, recently named the ODI Player of the Year, can win games with both batting and bowling. Notably, Afghan pacer Naveen-ul-Haq has switched from Texas Super Kings to MI New York.

MINY has also retained its core group of overseas stars, including Pollard, Pooran, Rashid, and Boult. However, the franchise has made bold calls by releasing Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and young sensation Dewald Brevis.

In addition to their international signings, MI New York have strengthened their domestic lineup by recruiting Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh. These local talents will support the franchise‚Äôs retained domestic players, including Monank Patel, Nosthush Kenjige, and Heath Richards.
summary:
**Team Update:** MI New York (MINY) has made significant changes to their squad ahead of the 2025 season, aiming to bounce back from a disappointing 2024 campaign.

**New Signings:** The team has acquired South African wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock and Afghan all-rounder Azmatullah Omarzai, strengthening their squad.

**Retained Players:** MINY has retained their core group of overseas stars, including Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, and Trent Boult.

**Released Players:** The franchise has parted ways with Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and Dewald Brevis.

**Domestic Signings:** MINY has recruited local talents Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh to support their retained domestic players.

**Background:** MINY had a dream debut season in 2023, winning the championship, but struggled in 2024.

title: Dewald Brevis joins Lhuan-dre Pretorius at Hampshire for T20 Blast
body:
Hampshire have signed South African batsman Dewald Brevis for the 2025 T20 Blast in the United Kingdom.

Brevis has been capped twice at T20I level by the Proteas ‚Äì and has played for the Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League.

He has also played in the Caribbean Premier League in the West Indies ‚Äì and Major League Cricket in the United States of America.

Brevis will be team-mates with fellow South African Lhuan-dre Pretorius at Hampshire.

Get Club Cricket SA news on Whatsapp

‚ÄúI‚Äôm hugely excited about joining Hampshire Hawks for the Blast. The team has a great history in the competition, and I look forward to being a part of that,‚Äù said Brevis.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great we have Lhuan-dre with us as well and hopefully we can put on a good show and entertain the crowd at Utilita Bowl on our way to reaching finals day and lifting the trophy.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm also looking forward to playing in the County Championship, the team were so close last year, and I hope I can help the club push for the title in 2025.‚Äù

Hampshire‚Äôs director of cricket Giles White added: ‚ÄúDewald is an exceptional young player who will add firepower to our batting line-up this summer. He will arrive having enjoyed good recent form, and alongside Lhuan-dre we will have two young cricketers that are hungry to make their mark.‚Äù

MORE latest SA players in county cricket news
summary: Dewald Brevis, a South African batsman, has played in the Major League Cricket tournament in the United States of America. No further details about his performance or experience in the tournament are provided in the article.

title: MLC 2025: MI New York Announce Signing of Top Stars Ahead of Major League Cricket Season Three
body:
Mumbai, April 4: MI New York unveiled the signings of star-studded players ahead of the upcoming edition of Major League Cricket, which is set to begin on June 13. For the month-long carnival in the US, MI New York will enjoy the services of South African duo Quinton de Kock and George Linde, Afghanistan's Naveen-ul-Haq and Azmatullah Omarzai and lastly, Michael Bracewell, who is serving as New Zealand's captain for their ongoing white-ball series against Pakistan. Agni Chopra Quits Indian Domestic Cricket! Son of Vidhu Vinod Chopra Signed by MI New York for MLC.

They join the overseas retained players, including Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Rashid Khan and Trent Boult; the domestic retained players, featuring Monank Patel, Nosthush Kenjige, Heath Richards, Ehsan Adil, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, and the 2025 draft picks Agni Chopra, Kunwarjeet Singh, Sharad Lumba and Tajinder Singh.

MI New York Squad fof MLC 2025

The experienced opener Quinton de Kock has been part of the MI Family. His stint with Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League lasted from 2019 to 2021, during which he lifted two titles with the franchise. George Linde played an integral role in MI Cape Town's 2025 title-winning run in the SA20 and has been a core team member since the first edition in 2023.

The Men's ODI Cricketer of the Year for 2024, Azmatullah Omarzai, who has been teammates with Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, and George Linde in MI Capetown, played an important role in winning the trophy for MI Capetown in 2025. Meanwhile, Naveen Ul Haq and Michael Bracewell will strive for MI New York's second MLC title in three years. MLC 2025: Travis Head, David Miller, Pat Cummins Not Retained Ahead of Major League Cricket Season 3 Draft.

In the past season, MI New York enjoyed the services of Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Dewald Brevis, Tim David and Romario Shepherd. However, the famed faces of the T20 format were released before MLC 2025. Steven Taylor, Rueben Clinton and Shayan Jahangir were the other local players who were released along with the overseas talent.

MI New York, who were the defending champions in the last season, endured a heartbreak at the hands of Texas Super Kings. With an almost flawlessly executed plan, the Texas Super Kings ended MI New York's title defence by handing them a comprehensive 9-wicket victory in the eliminator clash.

MI New York 2025 Squad: Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, Rashid Khan, Monank Patel, Nosthush Kenjige, Heath Richards, Ehsan Adil, Sunny Patel, Rushil Ugarkar, George Linde, Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, Naveen-ul-Haq, Azmatullah Omarzai, Kunwarjeet Singh, Sharad Lumba and Tajinder Singh, Agni Chopra.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The third edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to begin on June 13 and will run for a month in the US.

**MI New York Squad:**

* MI New York has unveiled its squad for MLC 2025, which includes star players like Quinton de Kock, George Linde, Naveen-ul-Haq, Azmatullah Omarzai, and Michael Bracewell.
* The squad also features retained players like Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Rashid Khan, and Trent Boult, as well as domestic retained players and draft picks.

**Background:**

* MI New York was the defending champion in the last season but lost to Texas Super Kings in the eliminator clash.
* The team has released players like Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Dewald Brevis, Tim David, and Romario Shepherd ahead of MLC 2025.

Note: The summary only includes information specific to the Major League Cricket tournament and does not include general information about the players or their performances in other leagues.

title: MI sign Quinton de Kock & Azmatullah Omarzai for MLC 2025
body:
MI New York (MINY) is gearing up for the new Major League Cricket (MLC) season with some new high-profile additions to their lineup. South Africa‚Äôs wicketkeeper batter Quinton de Kock and Afghanistan‚Äôs all-rounder Azmatullah Omarzai headline the new recruits for the franchise.

De Kock has seen glory in T20 cricket for a long time and also hung up his boots from international cricket last year to focus on league cricket. Now he is reunited with the MI franchise, as earlier he played for Mumbai Indians in IPL and won the cup twice in 2019 and 2020. MINY will look to leverage de Kock‚Äôs experience to improve on their last-place finish in the previous MLC season.

New recruits & returning stars

Joining de Kock is fellow South African George Linde, who earned his spot following success with MI Cape Town in the SA20 league. Linde will team up with his MI Cape Town teammate Azmatullah Omarzai, whose international profile has been rising, especially after being named ODI player of the year. Afghan bowler Naveen-ul-Haq will also join MINY, switching from the Texas Super Kings, enhancing the team‚Äôs Afghan representation.

Domestic and International talent revamp

The core of MINY remains strong with retained players Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan, providing a solid foundation for the team‚Äôs strategy. However, MINY has parted ways with Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and Dewald Brevis following a disappointing season last year.

In addition to international changes, MINY has refreshed their domestic lineup by signing Indian domestic talents like Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh to bolster their batting strength.

When is MLC‚Äôs new season starting?

The MLC season is set to begin on June 12, with the opening matches taking place in California at the Coliseum Stadium. This event marks MLC‚Äôs first expansion to the West Coast, promising to bring exciting cricket action to new fans. With their revamped roster, MINY aims to make a significant impact in the upcoming season.
summary:
**Team Update: MI New York (MINY)**

* MINY has made several high-profile additions to their lineup, including South Africa's Quinton de Kock and Afghanistan's Azmatullah Omarzai.
* Other new recruits include George Linde, Naveen-ul-Haq, and domestic talents Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh.

**Key Players**

* Retained players: Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan.
* Released players: Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and Dewald Brevis.

**Upcoming Season**

* The MLC season is set to begin on June 12.
* The opening matches will take place in California at the Coliseum Stadium, marking MLC's first expansion to the West Coast.

title: MLC 2025 Schedule, Squad, and Venue Details (Major League Cricket) ‚Äì iSportsLeague
body:
Cricket‚Äôs explosive growth in the United States takes center stage in 2025 as Major League Cricket (MLC) returns for its third season, poised to redefine the sport‚Äôs landscape in North America. Fresh off the momentum of the historic 2024 T20 World Cup co-hosted by the U.S., MLC 2025 promises to amplify the nation‚Äôs cricketing ambitions with a star-studded spectacle that blends global superstars, rising homegrown talent, and world-class venues. From June 12 to July 13, six dynamic franchises will battle across three iconic stadiums, delivering high-octane T20 action designed to captivate both die-hard fans and curious newcomers.

The third edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) will run from June 12 to July 13, 2025, featuring 34 matches across three weeks of group-stage clashes and playoffs. The tournament opens with a high-stakes rematch of the 2024 final, as defending champions Washington Freedom face San Francisco Unicorns at Oakland Coliseum on June 12

Major League Cricket 2025 Schedule

The MLC is scheduled to kick off on 12 June 2025 and will feature six teams. The league will be played over a period of one month, with a total of 34 matches to be played. Each team will play a total of 10 matches in a round-robin format, followed by the playoffs.

Here‚Äôs the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2025 schedule:

Venues: Matches are split between Oakland Coliseum (California), Grand Prairie Stadium (Dallas), and Central Broward Regional Park (Florida).

Playoffs: Teams for qualifiers, eliminator, and final will be decided based on league standings (TBC = To Be Confirmed).

Time Zones: Local times are in Pacific Time (California).

Major League Cricket 2025 Teams

Six franchises return for the 2025 season, each boasting star-studded squads:

Washington Freedom (Defending Champions): Led by Steve Smith and Travis Head, they aim to retain their title.

San Francisco Unicorns: Coached by Shane Watson, featuring Pat Cummins and Finn Allen.

Texas Super Kings: Captained by Faf du Plessis, with Devon Conway and Mitchell Santner.

MI New York: Kieron Pollard leads a powerhouse squad including Trent Boult and Nicholas Pooran.

Los Angeles Knight Riders: Sunil Narine captains Andre Russell and Jason Roy.

Seattle Orcas: Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton headline a revamped lineup

Major League Cricket 2025 Players

The MLC is set to attract top-quality international players from around the world. The league aims to provide a platform for players who are looking to showcase their skills and make a name for themselves. The team owners will have the opportunity to sign international players and local talent in the player auction.

Below are the final squad details for MLC 2025.

Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) 2025 Squad

MI New York (MNY) 2025 Squad

San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) 2025 Squad

Seattle Orcas (ORCA) 2025 Squad

Texas Super Kings (TSK) 2025 Squad

Washington Freedom (SO) 2025 Squad

MLC 2025 Venue

Matches will be held at three iconic U.S. venues:

Oakland Coliseum (California): Hosting nine matches, including the opener and Unicorns‚Äô home games. Capacity: 12,000.

Grand Prairie Stadium (Texas): The league‚Äôs flagship venue, hosting 16 matches, including playoffs. Capacity: 7,200.

Central Broward Park (Florida): Nine matches, including the final group-stage clashes. Capacity: 20,000.

Major League Cricket 2025 Broadcast
summary:
**Tournament Information:**

* The third season of Major League Cricket (MLC) will take place from June 12 to July 13, 2025.
* The tournament will feature 6 teams, playing 34 matches across 3 weeks of group-stage clashes and playoffs.
* Each team will play 10 matches in a round-robin format, followed by the playoffs.

**Schedule:**

* The tournament will start on June 12 with a rematch of the 2024 final between Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns at Oakland Coliseum.
* Matches will be held at three iconic U.S. venues: Oakland Coliseum (California), Grand Prairie Stadium (Texas), and Central Broward Regional Park (Florida).

**Teams:**

* The six franchises participating in the tournament are:
	1. Washington Freedom (Defending Champions)
	2. San Francisco Unicorns
	3. Texas Super Kings
	4. MI New York
	5. Los Angeles Knight Riders
	6. Seattle Orcas

**Players:**

* The tournament will feature top-quality international players from around the world, including Steve Smith, Travis Head, Shane Watson, Pat Cummins, Finn Allen, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Mitchell Santner, Kieron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Jason Roy, Heinrich Klaasen, and Ryan Rickelton.

**Venues:**

* Oakland Coliseum (California) will host 9 matches, including the opener and Unicorns' home games. Capacity: 12,000.
* Grand Prairie Stadium (Texas) will host 16 matches, including playoffs. Capacity: 7,200.
* Central Broward Park (Florida) will host 9 matches, including the final group-stage clashes. Capacity: 20,000.

title: Ross Taylor Named Seattle Orcas Ambassador
body:
Former New Zealand cricketing legend Ross Taylor has been selected as the Seattle Orcas Ambassador for Major League Cricket (MLC) Season 3. In this role, Taylor will focus on strengthening the Seattle Orcas brand, engaging with the local community, and fostering grassroots cricket development across the region.

Taylor served as batting coach in the first two MLC seasons, playing a key role in identifying and nurturing local talent, including his contributions to last season‚Äôs net bowler talent hunt.

A true legend of New Zealand cricket, Taylor amassed over 18,000 runs across all three formats, smashing 40 centuries along the way. Renowned for his signature pull shots and powerful slog sweeps, the right-handed batter etched his name in cricket history with his dynamic stroke play and clutch performances.

Taylor also captained New Zealand in 47 matches, including 13 Tests. He was a vital part of four ICC ODI World Cup campaigns, finishing as a runner-up in both 2015 and 2019. His unbeaten 47-run knock in the 2021 World Test Championship final was instrumental in securing New Zealand‚Äôs historic title.

Following a stellar playing career spanning nearly 15 years, Taylor transitioned into coaching, further cementing his impact on the sport. He is also an honorary life member of the prestigious Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) in London.

With his deep experience as both a player and a mentor, Ross Taylor is set to bring his expertise, leadership, and passion to his new role as the Seattle Orcas Ambassador, inspiring the next generation of cricketers in the US.
summary:
* Former New Zealand cricketer Ross Taylor has been appointed as the Ambassador for the Seattle Orcas team in Major League Cricket (MLC) Season 3.
* In this role, Taylor will focus on promoting the Seattle Orcas brand, engaging with the local community, and developing grassroots cricket in the region.
* Taylor has previous experience with MLC, having served as a batting coach in the first two seasons and contributing to the identification and development of local talent, including last season's net bowler talent hunt.

title: Toyota Announced as Official Partner of San Francsico Unicorns
body:
Northern California Toyota Dealers agree to inaugural partnership with San Francisco Unicorns Major League Cricket team for the 2025 season.

Unicorns‚Äô matchday uniforms to feature Toyota logo on pants, with the car brand also named as the Official Title Partner of the Family Day.

The San Francisco Unicorns has announced that Toyota, via its Northern California Toyota Dealers franchise, is to be its Official Partner for the 2025 Cognizant Major League Cricket season.

The Japanese car brand‚Äôs local dealership group has entered into a commercial partnership with an MLC team for the first time, with the brand set to receive both prominent logo placement on the team‚Äôs matchday trousers, as well as being named as the Official Title Partner of the ‚Äò2025 San Francisco Unicorns Family Day‚Äô. The partnership for the 2025 season was brokered by PIVOT Agency, on behalf of the Unicorns.

In the lead-up to the first game of the 2025 MLC season, which begins on June 12 2025, the Toyota dealership group will play a leading role in the activation of local Bay Area cricket fans, culminating in the latest edition of the Family Day (date and location to follow).

Fans attending Family Day will be able to meet their Unicorns cricketing heroes, receive playing tutorials, and take part in various other exciting cricketing experiences appealing to both established cricket fans and newcomers to the sport.

San Francisco Unicorns recently announced that they will be playing their first matches on home ground in Major League Cricket history, having agreed a multi-year deal to play at the Oakland Coliseum, with other MLC teams also scheduled to play at the iconic venue.

title: America is getting its first Major League Cricket stadium in Oakland
body:
Remember back when we first discovered the USA had a cricket team, and that they won a major upset in the Cricket World Cup?

Well, things are escalating on the "is this even America?" front.

Now, Major League Cricket (MLC) is getting a U.S. stadium all its own.

That's right!

The San Francisco Unicorns, one of the league's founding teams, will finally have home-field advantage.

The San Francisco Unicorns?

The cricket team is calling the Oakland Coliseum home because, and I quote ‚Ä¶

MLC picked the Oakland Coliseum because it's the only stadium in North American big enough for a cricket field.

And do you know why there aren't any other stadiums big enough to host a cricket match?

Because cricket is not an American sport.

One of my favorite parts of this story in the original article is when the USA's best cricket player, Saurabh Netravalkar, explained their win at the World Cup.

'So it was a really close game. It was tied on scores. And that went to a Super Over. It's like a penalty shoot-out in soccer. And that over was balled by me,' says Netravalkar with a big smile.

He explained it in terms of soccer.

Soccer!

So there you have it: Irrefutable evidence that cricket is not just un-American, it's un-American and gay.

P.S. Now check out our latest video üëá

Keep up with our latest videos ‚Äî Subscribe to our YouTube channel!
summary:
* The San Francisco Unicorns, a founding team of Major League Cricket (MLC), will have a home stadium at the Oakland Coliseum.
* The Oakland Coliseum was chosen because it is the only stadium in North America large enough to accommodate a cricket field.

No other information about the tournament schedule, players, or upcoming matches is mentioned in the article.

title: Seattle Orcas Tickets for Major League Cricket Season 3‚ÄîNow on Sale!
body:
Get ready, Seattle Orcas fans! Tickets for the highly anticipated third season of Major League Cricket (MLC) are officially available. Starting today, April 1, 2025, early-bird general tickets are up for grabs‚Äîproviding you a chance to lock in seats for an electrifying season of world-class cricket.

The Seattle Orcas will hit the road this season, playing in Oakland, Dallas, and Ft. Lauderdale‚Äîwith Oakland and Ft. Lauderdale making their debut as MLC venues. The campaign kicks off in Oakland, where the Seattle Orcas will play their first three matches at the iconic Oakland Coliseum, just a quick two-hour flight from Seattle. It‚Äôs the ultimate opportunity to witness America‚Äôs Favorite Cricket Team in action!

Secure your tickets now:Get Your Tickets

Podsquad, are you ready? Let‚Äôs pack the stands, bring the noise, and make this season one to remember. See you at the stadium!
summary:

title: Pooran smashes 137* as MI New York win Major League Cricket title
body:
Nicholas Pooran smacked an incredible 137 not out off 55 balls to lead MI New York past the Seattle Orcas to win the inaugural Major League Cricket title on Sunday in Dallas.

Chasing 184 for victory, Pooran came in without a run on the scoreboard after Steven Taylor went for a duck and proceeded to bring up his fifty off only 16 balls.

The left-handed Trinidad and Tobago batter then raced to his century off only 40 balls before icing the chase off the last ball of the 16th over.

Pooran hit 10 fours and 13 sixes in his monumental innings to bring the curtain down on a successful staging of Major League Cricket.

Earlier, the Seattle Orcas had put up a challenging 183 for 9 with Quinton de Kock hitting 87 off 52 balls.

Rashid Khan took 3 for 9 and Trent Boult 3 for 34 in the MI New York bowling effort.

‚ÄúWe spoke today about having an opportunity to do something special. Losing our captain, losing a couple of players along the way ‚Äì our players stuck together,‚Äù Pooran said after the match.

‚ÄúI am very proud of everything every individual did, everyone contributed in some way,‚Äù he added.

Pooran ended as the top run-scorer in the tournament with 388 runs, while Boult (22) had the most wickets.

Pooran‚Äôs innings won praise from Keiron Pollard who praised his fellow T&T player‚Äôs knock.

‚ÄúVery, very special innings from Nicky P, awesome. All the people that were here and were watching on TV, we get to witness something special,‚Äù said Pollard.
summary:
* The inaugural Major League Cricket title was won by MI New York, led by Nicholas Pooran's unbeaten 137 off 55 balls against the Seattle Orcas in the final in Dallas.
* Pooran's innings included 10 fours and 13 sixes, and he reached his century off just 40 balls to seal the win.
* Seattle Orcas had set a target of 184 for MI New York, thanks to Quinton de Kock's 87 off 52 balls.
* MI New York's bowling effort was led by Rashid Khan (3/9) and Trent Boult (3/34).
* Nicholas Pooran was the top run-scorer in the tournament with 388 runs, while Trent Boult took the most wickets with 22.
* Keiron Pollard praised Pooran's "very, very special" innings, calling it an "awesome" performance.

title: MLC 2025: Oakland to Broward, coast-to-coast action returns to the U.S. this summer
body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced the full schedule for its highly anticipated third season, with matches taking place across three major cricket hubs in the United States: California, Texas, and Florida.

This season kicks off on June 12 at the historic Oakland Coliseum, which will host its first-ever MLC match when the San Francisco Unicorns take on the Washington Freedom in a rematch of the dramatic 2024 Final. The opening weekend also features the tournament‚Äôs first double-header on June 14, when fans can enjoy both the Unicorns vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas vs. Washington Freedom with a single ticket.

After a full week of games in Oakland, the tournament shifts to its familiar stronghold in Grand Prairie, Texas, where 12 matches will be played over 9 days. The Texas Super Kings, led by South African legend Faf du Plessis, will face the Unicorns on June 20 to begin the Texas leg.

In a significant milestone for the league, Central Broward Park in Florida‚Äîone of the venues for the 2024 ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup‚Äîwill host its first-ever MLC match on July 1. The San Francisco Unicorns will face off against the Seattle Orcas in a West Coast rivalry clash featuring international stars like Ryan Rickelton and Sikandar Raza.

The Playoffs will return to Grand Prairie, starting with the Qualifier between the top two teams on July 8. The third and fourth-placed teams will battle for a spot in the second semi-final, with the Championship Final set for July 13.

‚ÄúCognizant Major League Cricket is rapidly expanding, and we‚Äôre thrilled to bring the excitement to three venues this season, giving even more fans the opportunity to experience the action live,‚Äù said Major League Cricket CEO Johnny Grave.

‚ÄúThe Oakland Coliseum is the perfect venue to launch Season 3, and we‚Äôre excited to see some of the world‚Äôs top cricket stars compete in such an iconic Californian location. We‚Äôre also proud to build on the legacy of the T20 World Cup in Broward and MLC‚Äôs continued success in Grand Prairie. Our teams consistently attract the best players in the world, and fans will once again have the chance to witness the biggest T20 cricket global stars like Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, Faf du Plessis, and Glenn Maxwell in action this season.‚Äù

Grave also noted the enthusiasm from fans: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen incredible demand for tickets during our pre-sale phase and expect that enthusiasm to soar with the public release of early bird tickets today.‚Äù

With top-tier venues, global T20 talent, and strategic expansion into new markets, MLC 2025 is set to build on its momentum and bring world-class cricket to fans across the U.S.
summary:
**Season and Schedule**: The third season of MLC will take place from June 12 to July 13, with matches held in California, Texas, and Florida.

**Key Matches**:

* The season kicks off on June 12 with a rematch of the 2024 Final between the San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom at Oakland Coliseum.
* A double-header will be held on June 14 featuring the Unicorns vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas vs. Washington Freedom.
* The Texas Super Kings will face the Unicorns on June 20 in Grand Prairie, Texas.
* Central Broward Park in Florida will host its first-ever MLC match on July 1, with the Unicorns facing the Seattle Orcas.

**Playoffs**: The playoffs will take place in Grand Prairie, starting with the Qualifier on July 8, followed by the semi-finals and the Championship Final on July 13.

**Tournament Details**:

* The tournament will feature three cricket hubs in the US: Oakland, California; Grand Prairie, Texas; and Central Broward Park, Florida.
* The league has attracted top international talent, including Faf du Plessis, Ryan Rickelton, Sikandar Raza, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, and Glenn Maxwell.
* Tickets are now available, with early bird tickets on sale following a successful pre-sale phase.

summary: The Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced the schedule for its third season, which will take place across three major cricket hubs in the United States: California, Texas, and Florida. The season will kick off on June 12 at the historic Oakland Coliseum, which will host its first-ever MLC match.

title: MLC 2025 Tickets Price with Booking Link and Procedure
body:
MLC 2025 Tickets: The Major League Cricket (MLC 2025) is set to begin on June 13 with the final to be played on June 14. Unlike last season, the tournament will be played across three venues ‚Äì Oakland Coliseum in California, Grand Prairie in Dallas and Central Broward Regional Park Stadium in Florida.

With the increase in the cricket fan base in the United States, MLC has grown with the increase in the games for the upcoming edition. The USA made a notable achievement in last year‚Äôs T20 World Cup, and since then, the craze for cricket matches has grown exponentially.

MLC 2025 Tickets

The MLC 2025 matches will be played in a Double round-robin and playoffs before the finals. As usual, six teams will play in the upcoming tournament.

Click on the BUY option below to book the Major League Cricket 2025 Tickets for the respective match.

All Grand Prairie Regular Season Matches ‚Äì Tickets start at $180.00

You‚Äôll get access to all regular season matches happening at Grand Prairie Stadium

All Central Broward Matches ‚Äì Tickets start at $100.00

You‚Äôll get access to all NINE matches happening at Lauderhill, Florida.

All Oakland Coliseum season Matches ‚Äì Tickets start at $120.00

You‚Äôll get access to all NINE matches happening at Oakland, California.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The MLC 2025 tournament is set to begin on June 13 and end on July 14 (Note: The exact end date is not specified in the article, but it's mentioned that the final will be played on July 14).
* The tournament will be played across three venues: Oakland Coliseum in California, Grand Prairie in Dallas, and Central Broward Regional Park Stadium in Florida.

**Format:**

* The tournament will feature six teams playing in a double round-robin format, followed by playoffs and finally the finals.

**Ticket Information:**

* Tickets are available for purchase, with prices starting at:
	+ $180.00 for all Grand Prairie regular season matches
	+ $100.00 for all Central Broward matches
	+ $120.00 for all Oakland Coliseum season matches
